pr_title: applying limit when creating the partition filter

timeline.message: applying limit when creating the partition filter
reversing order so we pick new partitions first by default (given partitions are date strings)

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Fixed issue were limit is ignore when generating a partition filter. See [#164](https://github.com/HotelsDotCom/circus-train/issues/164).
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
            Fixed issue where limit is ignore when generating a partition filter. See [#164](https://github.com/HotelsDotCom/circus-train/issues/164).
timeline.author: max-jacobs
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,6 +1,8 @@
 ## [15.1.0] - TBD
 ### Changed
 * AVRO Schema Copier now re-uses the normal 'data' copier instead of its own. See [#162](https://github.com/HotelsDotCom/circus-train/issues/162). 
+### Fixed
+Fixed issue were limit is ignore when generating a partition filter. See [#164](https://github.com/HotelsDotCom/circus-train/issues/164).

timeline.bodyText: How comes this isn't initialised to UNLIMITED here? This is only to figure out the limit on line 183 in HiveDifferences right?
timeline.author: max-jacobs

replies.bodyText:
UNLIMITED is max int
partitionLimit for hive fetch partition call is -1 for being unlimited.
So I map -1 to max int in HiveDiferences so my loop nicely reads while (i < limit) https://github.com/HotelsDotCom/circus-train/blob/3a5e3bfaefe28ddcd500fa8a3451f6489005b2e7/circus-train-comparator/src/main/java/com/hotels/bdp/circustrain/comparator/hive/HiveDifferences.java#L219
it's mostly sugarcoating to be honest...
replies.author: patduin

timeline.author: nvitucci
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,6 +1,8 @@
 ## [15.1.0] - TBD
 ### Changed
 * AVRO Schema Copier now re-uses the normal 'data' copier instead of its own. See [#162](https://github.com/HotelsDotCom/circus-train/issues/162). 
+### Fixed
+Fixed issue were partition-limit is not correctly applied when generating a partition filter. See [#164](https://github.com/HotelsDotCom/circus-train/issues/164).

timeline.author: nvitucci

replies.bodyText: then it's 0, and stays 0 and you get 0 partitions back just like you asked :)
replies.author: patduin

timeline.bodyText: Think you also need a line between Changed and Fixed?
timeline.author: max-jacobs
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,6 +1,8 @@
 ## [15.1.0] - TBD
 ### Changed
 * AVRO Schema Copier now re-uses the normal 'data' copier instead of its own. See [#162](https://github.com/HotelsDotCom/circus-train/issues/162). 
+### Fixed

timeline.bodyText: Isn't this also a change in behaviour that we should mention in the CHANGELOG? HiveDiff will now process the partitions with newest first while in the past it was oldest first?
timeline.author: massdosage

timeline.bodyText: I can't make up my mind whether this would be considered a breaking change. Technically I think it is, but I guess most of our end users wouldn't notice?
timeline.author: massdosage

replies.bodyText: I was doubting if we should make it configurable, but to be honest i you're using hiveDiff and your whole table is copied its all the same. It's just for the backfill, I think it's not a breaking change.
replies.author: patduin

replies.bodyText: OK, then let's just document it in the CHANGELOG. If there is an easy place to mention the order that HiveDiff processes the partitions in the README that would be nice but not required. We could add a feature to make it configurable in the future if anyone ever actually needs it.
replies.author: massdosage

timeline.message: Added note about the HiveDiff order

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            * Changed the order of the generated partition filter (HiveDiff) it is now reverse natural order (which means new partitions first when partitions are date/time strings). When in doubt use the circus-train-tool `check-filters.sh` to so what would be generated.
          
          
            
            * Changed the order of the generated partition filter used by "HiveDiff"  - it is now reverse natural order (which means new partitions first when partitions are date/time strings). When in doubt use the circus-train-tool `check-filters.sh` to see what would be generated.
timeline.author: massdosage
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,6 +1,7 @@
 ## [15.1.0] - TBD
 ### Changed
 * AVRO Schema Copier now re-uses the normal 'data' copier instead of its own. See [#162](https://github.com/HotelsDotCom/circus-train/issues/162). 
+* Changed the order of the generated partition filter (HiveDiff) it is now reverse natural order (which means new partitions first when partitions are date/time strings). When in doubt use the circus-train-tool `check-filters.sh` to so what would be generated.
